page.title: 05MAPLEDURHAM WATERMILL
page.content: Mapledurham Watermill is situated in an area of outstanding natural beauty near the Elizabethan Mapledurham House. It stands on the site of the original mill mentioned in the Domesday Book.The walls and some timbers of the 15th century mill can be seen in the framework of the present one. It is the last working corn and grist mill on the Thames.Wheat grown on Mapledurham farms is ground by the old millstones using the ancient wooden machinery turned by an undershot waterwheel.The wholemeal flour is sold to shops and local bakeries.Part of the film "The Eagle Has Landed" was shot here and the fee used to repair and replace machinery since the mill had fallen into disuse after the second war.
